data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 9 steps right. If you continue facing forward, you take 9 steps right. Take 9 steps left takes you 10 steps forward. If you continue facing left, you take 9 steps forward. Take 9 steps right takes you 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 4 steps and go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Let's say you are to turn left and you take one step. You then take 7 steps and then turn left and take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’ t finish a ziggurat on the left end when you have to turn right. The answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you return to the starting point from the right (turn left) you go right then turn around again and take 7 steps to the right once you are out of the circle. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The third instruction is to turn left twice, which in turn, takes one step and returns to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps to return to the starting point. If you take 6 steps, you take 1 step back. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you face forward always always you are looking at the next point ahead. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you turn around, you take 2 steps. When you turn around, you take 7 steps. Saying you take 3 steps, gives the answer. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions are in the order: Step backward Take 1 step backward Take 1 step backward Take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward you cannot take 5 steps left and 2 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Either you were facing forward or you were facing backward. Forward was not the destination. Backward was not the destination. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always facing forward. Each direction will be taken with the same motion. The fourth step is always taken from the left. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, the start position is your starting point. It takes 3 feet to walk the length of 1 step forward. It takes 6 feet to make that same step backwards. They are different amounts of distance to travel for the same amount of steps. If you always take 3 steps right, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and turn around to the right. Take 4 steps and turn left. This is the way you get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can not take 3 steps following the previous instructions. You also cannot take 6 steps following the previous instructions. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In both directions there are 4 ways to get back to the starting point. If you do the following, you make a circular motion from the first point where your left foot ends and you start to walk backward in this direction, to where you ended up. This is the same way that we make a round motion from the first point where you start, to where you ended up in the previous directions. The final answer: yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left after taking 9 steps. Turn left to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right, take 4 steps, turn on your right foot, walk 5 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps to get back to the start point.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you can’t turn back. The easiest way to turn around is to back-turn. The final answer: No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around and take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Just because you always "face forward" doesn't mean you are always facing towards you right. Actually, facing backward doesn't imply that you are facing toward you left. The second step is also called the 1st step. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One starts with always facing forward and one starts backward. Take backward 7 steps and go right 9 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Any direction can turn, so turn the direction to turn around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The way forward is the same as facing inward. If one takes 6 steps left, one must take 6 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions state that you take around 5 steps then turn around. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can take any number of steps forward until you finish your instructions. You can not reverse directions, except to start from the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps to get back to the starting point. Take 1 step to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the first sentence, the instructions ask you to take 9 steps and turn around. The answer: yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you turn and walk left you should take 4 steps backwards no matter what direction your facing. If you turn and walk right you should take 4 steps backwards no matter what direction your facing. If you turn and walk left you should take 4 steps backwards no matter what direction your facing. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Before you turn around, the first step is to take 4 steps and then after you turn around to take 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step is always faced forward. Step 1 is always facing backward. Step 1 is always backward. Step 2 is always forward. The first step is always facing forward. Step 2 is always forward. The second step is always backward. Step 2 is always backward. The third step is always forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 4 steps right if you are facing left. If you are facing right then take 4 steps right. If you are facing left then take 5 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Reversing a step is a counterpoint to the direction you started in. The opposite direction of a step is to look in the opposite direction. In addition, to return to a previous position, you take steps to the opposite direction and then return to the same position. Taking 3 steps forward always returns where as taking 3 steps backward always returns where you started from. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 8 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around and take 2 steps, you are done. The opposite direction you came from is the one you turned around in. So, the answer is Yes.

Always facing forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. So, the answer is No.

Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Backwards goes back. It' s the same as forwards. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Any time you step backward you're stepping forward. The starting point is always facing forward. A person who always acts oblivious of the direction of their motion will never return to their starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You begin with a straight line running down the street, you turn right down the street, and you turn around in the direction you want to go. So, the answer is yes.

You always take 4 steps left, so you always should always face forward. The right directions are 10 steps backward and 7 steps left. The left directions are 8 steps right and 4 steps left. So, the answer is No.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are always facing forward, and you have the option of facing left or right, you go in every direction and always take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward then you take 8 steps left and take 5 steps left then take 6 steps backward and you take 9 steps forward and you go in every direction. There is no backwards. So, the answer is yes.

Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. So, the answer is no.

All of the steps in steps 1-9 return you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 3 steps down each corner, right. Take 3 steps back to the starting point. Take 1 step forward.. So, the answer is No.

If you always always face forward at the same time, you always go forward. The first two steps backward are 5 steps. So, the answer is no.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 8 steps backward, you are unable to return to the starting point. The first item doesn’ t matter because you started at the starting point. So, the answer is No.

A person always facing forward. Remember, always face forward. In order to come back forward, the person must start from the beginning. So, the answer is no.
